title: How is sodium bigger than potassium? - Quora

response.answer_text: It isn't. Sodium: Atomic radius 186 pm Covalent radius 166 pm Van set Walls radius 227 pm Potassium: Atomic radius 227 pm Covalent radius 203 pm Van der Waals radius 275 pm As you can clearly see, Sodium is smaller than Potassium.
